docs.lead_paragraph: With thousands of abortion protesters swarming the city in their annual March for Life, Republicans muscled broadened abortion restrictions through the House on Thursday after a GOP rebellion forced leaders into an awkward retreat on an earlier version.

headline.main: GOP Pushes Abortion Bill Through House on March for Life Day
headline.print_headline: GOP Pushes Abortion Bill Through House on March for Life Day

docs.lead_paragraph: Customers to Girard Brasserie and Bruncherie might be in for a surprise when they read the note attached to their bills: "Tipping is not necessary."

headline.main: No-Tip Restaurant Offers Food for Thought on Pay, Benefits

docs.lead_paragraph: Leading Republican senators on Wednesday introduced a bill to repeal one of Obamacare's most unpopular provisions - the individual mandate that requires most Americans to obtain health insurance or pay a penalty.

docs.lead_paragraph: One admires the chutzpah of party operatives whose platform opposes same-sex marriage hoping the justices will save them from having to choose sides in a fading culture war.

headline.seo: The Supreme Court Won’t End the Gay Marriage Debate for Republicans

docs.lead_paragraph: We need a plan based on growth and work, not redistribution.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Columbia Business School Dean Glenn Hubbard maintains Pres Obama's State of the Union economic proposals are merely talking points and warns they have no hope of passing a Republican Congress; offers that they can provide plan for tax and entitlement reform, one based on growth and work, not redistribution.
docs.snippet: We need a plan based on growth and work, not redistribution.

docs.lead_paragraph: A day before a threatened strike, an agreement was reached that grants more than 1,200 workers raises in each of three years.
